main event: A single oval-shaped white object was observed moving horizontally at a constant rate for approximately 4 hours at Hanscom Field in Massachusetts.
interesting points: The object was first observed on February 7, 1961 at around 10:00 PM and followed the same path as the previous night.
The object was about the size of a half dollar and had no discernible features or details.
The object was observed at an angle of elevation of 30 degrees and an azimuth of 290 degrees.
The object disappeared like the setting sun, going down below the horizon.
The weather conditions were clear with calm winds, and there was no other unusual activity or conditions that could account for the sighting.
